result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Ralph Oiyotte Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1) The defendant shall undergo all programming and/or counseling required by the DOC.
2) The defendant shall contact the Burnett County Sheriff's Department within 7 days and provide his DNA (if needed).
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on July 26, 2021 at 09:30 am.

09:14 AM Cases 15CF20 and 20CF170 called together.  Defendant, Louis Ralph Oiyotte, appeared with Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  All appear by video.  Case 15CF20 on for sentencing and 20CF170 on for plea/sentencing hearing.  Discussion of restitution, parties to request a restitution hearing.  Case 20CF170 proceeds to Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Reid: def pleading to 20CF170 to amended Count 1: joyride (M); with a joint rec regarding both files.  Atty Schmidt recites the sentencing recommendation: 2 years probation concurrent on the two cases, amending Count 1 of 20CF170 to misdemeanor joyriding (943.23(3m).  Motion to amend Criminal complaint to violation of 943.23(3m).  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of No Contest.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of joyriding and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement regarding sentencing in both files: probation conditions requested-AODA and follow through (if not done already); no contact with victim in 20CF170 "T.L.", requests restitution hearing, asks for standard court costs.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, notes 51 days credit and 53 days of credit; stipulated to by parties.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  Court orders:
15CF20: withheld sentence, 2 years probation 
20CF170: withheld sentence, 2 years probation 
Conditions: AODA and follow through, counseling per DOC, court costs on each ($443), provide DNA to Sheriff's Department, no contact with victim 20CF170.  Jail credit 51 days 20CF170 and 63 on 15CF20.
Restitution hearing to be set.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff within 7 days.  Report to probation within 48 hours.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 26, 2021 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 24, 2021 at 09:15 am.

09:50 AM 15CF20 and 20CF170 called together.  Defendant, Louis Ralph Oiyotte, appeared with Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney.  Attys by video.  Defendant by phone.  Atty Schmidt recites agreement: DJOC in 15CF20 has been vacated; agreement for def to plead to Count 1 in 20CF170 without repeater, ask to sentence both, withheld sentence, 2 year probation, programming per DOC.  Atty Reid adds, believed the agreement was for a misdemeanor count of "joyriding"; parties review and discuss offer.  Court will adjourn for parties to get this sorted.  Atty Schmidt will be doing the adjourned SEH and PLEAS.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2021 at 09:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 10, 2021 at 09:45 am.

09:09 AM Cases 15CF20 and 20CF170 called together.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid appeared by video means for Defendant Louis Ralph Oiyotte. Prosecuting Atty Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video means. Defendant Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by phone means.  Cases on for status conference.  Atty Reid updates the Court: prepared to go to sentencing in the 2015 case and PLEA/S in 2020 case.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 10, 2021 at 09:45 am.

01:52 PM Cases 20CF170 and 15CF20 called together.  Defendant Louis Ralph Oiyotte in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant in custody in Pine County jail.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court moves to Anderson's calendar, gives 10 days to discuss substitution.  Def makes statement.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2021 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 12, 2021 at 09:00 am.
$500 cash bond to cover warrants in Burnett County cases 15CF20 and 20CF170.

09:39 AM Cases 15CF20 and 20CF170 called together.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear for a status conference.  Atty Reid in person, ADA Steffen by video.  Atty Reid updates: no longer at the Ruth house, does not know where defendant is or how to contact him at this point.  State updates the court: 15CF case was to be set for sentencing.  State asks for warrant, $1000 cash bond.  Atty Reid asks for $250-$500 cash bond on warrant instead, argues.  Court orders warrant, $500 cash bond.
Status conference on January 21, 2021 at 09:00 am.

02:19 PM Called 15CF20 and 20CF170 for STC.  Defendant, Louis Ralph Oiyotte, appeared by video with Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid by video.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State by video.  Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney.  Attny Reid updates court.  Case 15CF20 needs a sentencing and for case 20CF170 one more STC or set for trial. Schedule time block for Attny Reid's STC's on January 21st at 9am. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2021 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 30, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

02:51 PM Cases 15CF20 and 20CF170 called together.  Defendant, Louis Ralph Oiyotte, appeared with Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.  Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney in person.  Cases on for status conference.  Atty Reid updates the Court: discussions were held regarding both cases, an offer has been made, defendant wants to make a counter offer, believes 15CF20 just needs a sentencing hearing, 20CF170 has not been resolved yet, but offers have been made.  Defendant makes a statement.  Atty Reid provides phone number to def.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Only the judge may quash this body-only warrant.

02:37 PM Cases 20CF170 and 15CF20 called together.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Reid by video.  Court by video.  Atty Steffen by phone.  Def fails to appear.  Court lifts the stay on the warrant- only judge may quash.

03:08 PM Cases called 20CF170 and 15CF20 for Louis Oiyotte AKA Louis Workman. Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court in person.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Def. does not appear by any means.   State request warrant, body only in WI and adjacent states.  Attny Reid asks court not to issue warrant.  Court will stay warrant.  Court expects def in person on 9-17-2020 and expects plan for future events/ scheduling.  If fail to appear at next STC warrant will be issued and cash forefit.  Adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2020 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on September 17, 2020 at 03:15 pm.

10:40 AM Cases 20CF170 and 15CF20 called together.  Defendant Louis Ralph Oiyotte in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Louis Ralph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney.  All parties appear by phone/video means due to COVID19 mandates.  Case 15CF20 on for status conference, Court reviews events of the case: was on DJOC, State filed motion for entry of judgment; def failed to appear twice, and Court allowed State to revoke agreement.  Defense has filed a bond motion.  Court addresses multiple missed appearances, defendant explains he had issues in MN cases, states he is off of probation.  State asks Court to set 15CF20 for sentencing hearing.  Case 20CF170 on for preliminary hearing.  Court advises def of right to have an in-person hearing; defendant waives KIV.  State calls first witness, officer Trevor Thiex, who is sworn in by the Court and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Reid crosses.  State redirects.  Witness steps down.  No further witnesses called.  State argues for bindover.  Atty Reid argues against bindover, raises jurisdictional issue.  State makes rebuttal.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State efiles information.  Separate arraignment date requested.  Discussion of STC/Sentencing hearing.  Both cases proceed to bond modification hearing.  Atty Reid requests signature bond or low cash bond to cover both files.  State responds.  Court orders cash bond of $250 to cover both files and conditions of the bond in both cases are applicable.  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

No use or possession of any vehicle unless he is the registered owner of said vehicle or has the owner's written permission.  No contact with T.L. or his residence.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is subject to random testing of breath, blood, or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon reasonable suspicion or arrest.  No use or possession of any drugs, substances, or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

02:36 PM Defendant Louis Ralph Workman not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has not made contact with the Court.  State requests warrant.  Court issues warrant, $500 cash bond.
